nio/Buffer.description: The Buffer block will collect all incoming signals and emit them every **interval**. If **interval_duration** is non-zero, then the signal emitted each **interval** will be all the signals collected over the last **interval_duration**.

backup_interval.title: Backup Interval
backup_interval.description: An interval of time that specifies how often persisted data is saved.

group_by.title: Group By
group_by.description: The signal attribute on the incoming signal whose values will be used to define groups on the outgoing signal.

interval.title: Buffer Interval
interval.description: Time interval at which signals are emitted.

interval_duration.title: Interval Duration
interval_duration.description: At each **interval**, emit signals collected during this amount of time. If unspecifed or 0, then all incoming signals collected during the last **interval** will be emitted.

load_from_persistence.title: Load from Persistence?
load_from_persistence.description: If `True`, the blockâ€™s state will be saved when the block is stopped, and reloaded once the block is restarted.

signal_start.title: Start Interval on Signal?
signal_start.description: If `True`, start the first interval when a signal is received.

default.description: Signals stored since the time specified by the **interval_duration**.
